meanings.definition: A short sentence or phrase, especially one said or sung by a priest in a church service.
meanings.sent1: During the church service, the priest recited a versicle to the congregation.
meanings.sent2: The versicle the priest chanted was a familiar part of the Sunday ritual.
meanings.sent3: The playful priest surprised everyone by singing a versicle in a deep voice.
meanings.sent4: The versicle echoed through the church, filling the air with sacred words.
meanings.sent5: The memorable versicle lingered in the minds of the worshippers long after the service ended.

meanings.definition: A small decorative panel or tablet with a religious image or text.
meanings.sent1: The intricate versicle displayed a beautiful painting of a saint.
meanings.sent2: She admired the delicate craftsmanship of the antique versicle in the church.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to sneak a peek at the hidden versicle behind the altar.
meanings.sent4: The versicle on the wall seemed to glow with a divine light.
meanings.sent5: Visitors marveled at the ornate details of the ancient versicle.
